title: Processes - Average Value of a Function

content.question: The graph of the continuous function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> consists of three line segments, as shown above. What is the average value of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 2 comma 8, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>8</mn><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
